name: Melia Puerto Vallarta All Inclusive Beach Resort

reviews.title: Great resort but we had a bad room
reviews.text: My wife and I were guests from January 21st to January 28th 2009 at the Melia property. We stayed in unit 702.

reviews.title: Beautiful place, good value for money
reviews.text: We were both impressed by the food quality, the room comfort & view from our balcony and the level of service we received from the staff. Fortunately there were not a lot of children at the resort during our 5-night stay. The evening entertainment was not particularly enjoyable. We enjoyed 2 dinners at Vitrales (Italian) & 1 dinner at Azulejos (Mexican). Two evenings we dined off-property with friends. The buffet breakfasts and lunches were excellent with plenty of selection.

reviews.title: Great Experience at Melia
reviews.text: While we were guests, my wife noticed a moisture/mold problem in our room. She complained daily about an odd smell. Today I noted a similar complaint in a Trip Advisor review from another guest who stayed on the same floor with a room that faced the garden & downtown similar to ours.

reviews.title: Nice Resort...But Beware of Room Theft
reviews.text: Three weeks later, all of the clothing that we brought to Mexico and both suitcases still smell like room 702. My wife has left the suitcases out in our garage for several weeks & now has decided to throw them out. Each piece of clothing from our trip to Puerta Vallarta has been hot laundered five times and put in the dryer five times but still smells musty.

reviews.title: Nothing Special, Go Elsewhere
reviews.text: We are frequent world travelers and take many trips to Mexico, the Caribbean and the southern USA each winter. We have never encountered a problem like this before. J&J

reviews.title: Loved Every Minute of Our Holiday
reviews.text: OK So I Use this website faithfully on any trips we have gone on. So I guess now it's time for my 2 cents worth. We stayed at the Melia from Feb 7th- 14th.

reviews.title: Good but a bit noisy.
reviews.text: First time for my immediate family to PV. My husband and I, 18 year old Daughter, 13 year old son, Daughter & Son In Law and 9 Month old grandson. My Mom & Dad (who have been to PV for the last 10 years). First of all Check in was smooth for us we had a family room and a regular room. The family room was on the ground floor and had a dampness to it that we got used to by the end of the trip. It could also use some updating. Our safe didn't work the entire trip and had numerous maintenance people in to try and fix it. Bathroom door didn't shut properly either. Now we didn't complain at all because we took the attitude well it's Mexico and really we were only in the room to sleep. Daughter, Son in Law and babies' room was one floor up and they had a beautiful room. Now here is where it gets bad. My Mom & Dad had paid for an oceanfront room with the "M" experience and were given the wrong room on the first day. When my Mom went down and complained they said her room wouldn't be ready until 3 pm the next day. At 3 pm the next day she still wasn't in her room and had to go and demand that she be put in her room imediately that really she was losing money that she had paid out. Finally by 5 pm they were in the proper room. She got compensated with 2 free 1 hour massages (which they loved) and Champagne. So all in all the hotel did try to make it up to them.

reviews.title: awesome staff....
reviews.text: The Melia has beautiful grounds that are lush and green and we really enjoyed walking around in the evening.

reviews.title: Most relaxing family vacation I've ever taken
reviews.text: We stayed mostly at the resort and enjoyed the food and shows. The activity staff is alot of fun and really try to get the guest involved in all the daily activities. We ate at all the restaurants and enjoyed all of them.

reviews.title: Nice average place
reviews.text: The pool was great and extremely large. We never had a problem finding lounge chairs for all 8 of us.

The wife and I visited the Melia for 5 days in 2004 and decided it would be a great place to bring the girls (5,14 and 16) and another family (3 boys) for spring break. It was exactly what we expected. Our two oldest had a good time laying around reading and tanning, they even found time to play volleyball and water polo. The 5 y/o chose NOT to participate in the kids club which put more demand on dad to swim and go to the beach. Alas, what's a dad to do??
reviews.title: Just as good the second time
Puerto Vallarta--Can't wait to go back!
reviews.text: Property: as thoroughly pointed out, very well maintained.

reviews.title: The Melia needs to get their act in order!
reviews.text: Rooms: Definately ready for planned rehab although VERY clean and servicable. Every air conditioned room in EVERY tropical locale that I have ever visited smelled a bit musty (especially when the air is turned off for awhile).

Food: I thought it was great. Remember, this is NOT a LUXURY resort. Very nice, yes. Fresh fruits and vegetables always excellent, good variety. Some of the concoctions are interesting to consider but tasty none-the-less. The reservations only dinner options were only OK when we tried them last year so we only did one (the outdoor Palapa) this time. Dinner there was good, nice view of the bay...worth it. Breakfasts were very good, probably improved over a year ago. Lunch outside is always good, pizza, pasta, fruit, guac (1/2 the days), misc fish, salad...get the picture? Not everything to my taste but always a few good options. Hot dogs, burgers and fries throughout the PM.
reviews.title: Great Family Resort

reviews.text: Drinks: plenty. Remember to tip your servers, they will remember your favorites and keep all but the most thirsty patrons in good supply, "extra shot of rum, please."
reviews.title: Great Service/Location
Una otra dia en paradisio!!
reviews.text: Another day in paradise! This was our second trip to The Melia, and my eighth trip to Puerto Vallarta! We,(myself, my spouse, my 17 yr old daughter, her friend, my 65 yr old mother, my sister from CA., her husband and their 5 yr old twin boys) all arrived at the Melia Saturday March 5th, 2005. We spent a glorious week basking in the sun. I was concerned that the rest of my family would not like The Melia, the food or the accomodations. I was paranoid from the bad reviews that I had read. Mind you, I was there last year and loved it.l I was beginning to think I was crazy! Everyone in my family absolutely LOVED The Melia! They thoroughly enjoyed the food, they thought the rooms were just fine. The service is beyond reproach. My daughter and her friend danced to the band in the Lobby Bar each nite, the 5 yr old twins had a heyday in the pool and getting icecream at the Grille. My mother had a nice double room, the teenage girls had a double, the family from California had a "family room" with bunk beds and we had a king size room. We would not trade our "spring break" for anything. The people working at The Melia are as nice as can be and they only aim to please. They deserve your tips and appreciation! The food was great...grilled fish, shrimp fajitas, and of course many Mexican specialties. Also, I'd like to say that we are seasoned travelers. This wasn't our first rodeo! I have stayed at fancy hotels and inadvertently stayed at dives. The Melia is a value vacation with the nicest pool, grounds and service available. The rooms are nice, not fancy, but nice, and the food excellent. Go to the Melia and enjoy another day in paradise!!!!!

reviews.title: A good holiday
reviews.text: Puerto Vallarta Jan 15-22 , once again a success, weather was a little cooler than last trip, but still agreat time. Food was good, but once you have a buffet they are quite similar. Did not come home gaining weight this trip but ate well. stayed at the Melia. staff as friendly as ever the time shares sellers did not seem as pushy this time, we just kept saying no and walking. All side trips were good and learned more of what the life of PV and area is about. Good times, will go back again.

reviews.title: Better than expected
reviews.text: I had rather low expectations after reading some of the reviews on this website. But, let me tell you, the Devil was not nearly that black! Indeed, it is not a 5 star hotel by American/Canadian standards. 3.5 stars is more like it. Melia is a good hotel for families. The Kids Club is a good option to park the kids for part of the day. The grounds are beautiful and very well maintained. The rooms are all right. They do have a slight musty smell, but it is inevitable given the exterior humidity. The food is plenty, but the selection is not very wide. The fish and the chicken were always very tasty. Pizza, hamburgers and hot-dogs were avaliable for lunch to please the kids. The beach is small, and the ocean water tends to be rough. Beware of the strong undertow. Although the pool is not heated, the water temperature is very enjoyable, especially on the very sunny days. The variety of the drinks served in the bars althroughout the hotel premises is rather limited (beer, margaritas, pinacoladas, tequilla). There is very little alcohol in the cocktails, which in hindsight is a good thing, as one can sip drinks all day long without getting drunk (and abnoxious). Should one need more buzz in the drinks, one should tip the waiter that makes the rounds in the pool area ($1/day). Tipping is a great way to get things done for you. We spent in total about $60 in tips, but it was well worth it ($2 for the bell boy when ariving and departing, $1/day to the maid, $1/day to the pool waiter, $2 for each meal in the a la carte restaurants, $1 for breakfast, lunch or dinner, and $5 for the girl in charge at the Kids Club). Remember that the staff is Mexican, and they are rather poorly paid. A bonus was that we were never approached by time-share sales people (I can't even tell if ther were any in the hotel). Overall, for the money we have paid, it was worth it.

This all inclusive was rated 5 red apples by Apple and it should be 3. I have been to other resorts in Mexico on which I base my evaluation. The rooms were spaciaous and nicely furnished; however, the cleanliness left something to be desired. The food lacked pinache. Being a foody, I noticed that it seemed that the chef has excellent ingredients but seems to lack training. The food choices at dinner were lacking. The presentation and choice of menus was unimaginative. The bar had no menu for drinks and also lacked choices of drinks despite adequate ingredients. The spa also lacked choices/menu. One could only have a message outdoors at the beach, even when the weather is inclamite. The most notable deficiency is the size of the beach which we immediately noticed.
reviews.title: Where's the Beach?

reviews.text: We just returned from the Melia March 8th. We all enjoyed the Melia very much and would return again. We have two boys 15 and 17. Our 17 year old had a birthday during our stay. The hotel brought a beautiful yummy large piece of cake decorated really nice to our room for him.
reviews.title: Family with teenagers loved the Melia
mexico lover
reviews.text: My Family and I went to Melia Feb 26- March 5th 2005, and id have to say it was an awesome awesome place very beautiful. This Trip To Mexico Was My First time flying and first time out of canada. The rooms were very clean and the activites there were awesome. I'd have to say they do keep you active with your stay down there with a wide varitey. I like their Flintstone theme for the kids and the nightly entertainment was awesome id say i had a crush on one of the male dancers. It was a great birthday present since two days after we left it was my 17th birthday. There Food was awesome but it got boring eating some of the same things each night. I wasnt to up for trying anything. the service was fabolous. i love all the waiters they were all nice and they put a smile on once you said something to them in spanish. The Pool and the shopping would have to be my favourite thats mostly what i did the whole vacation. All the Cruise ships that came into the marina were hugh and waking up to seeing those was awesome. If Your in Puerto Vallarta You Have to Absolouty have to take a excersion. We went on one to Los Calletas Island and you get to whale watch. If you go at the right time you can see humpback whales and dolphins. on the boat to the island we seen a mama humpback, Baby and an escort. As well with a couple of turtles. From the Beachline Boardwalk, My mom and i on a day of shopping saw dolphins jumping out of the water. That was awesome considering my favourite animal is a Dolphin. The Music and the Life at Melia was awesome. I loved Puerto Vallarta so much that I'm Learning Spanish Because Some friends and I would love to move there one day.. Melia Beach Resort Gets Two Thumbs Up. I cant wait to go back!!

reviews.title: Awesome Vacation!!!!!
reviews.text: We stayed at the Melia from March 26th to April 2nd. There were 15 of us ages ranging from 12 to 50. We had the time of our lives. There is so much to see and do there. The hotel is spotless, the food was awesome - especially the omelet lady - she could make 8 omelets at a time. There were so many activities to keep the teenagers busy and they did not complain once. The pool was huge and kept very clean. The hotel staff was very friendly and accomodating. Our waiter Diego was awesome. He knew what everyone's drinks were and had them waiting for us when we came down for our meals. A few dollars goes a long way. We celebrated 3 birthdays and 1 anniversary and the Mariachi Loco serenaded us practically every nite. They even have their own cd for sale. (Which by the way I listen to every day.) We all did Rythms of the Night - that was a blast and the kids did the Dolphin Swim. Both were great. We were a bit skeptical at first especially after reading some of the reviews but I'll tell you this place was awesome and we would definitely go back. There are so many more things to see and do I hope we go back next spring break.

reviews.title: Best vacation ever!
reviews.text: My husband and I went there for our honeymoon. I was a little reluctant because of the poor reviews I had seen on this website. I am so glad that we went, it was truly the best vacation I have ever had. The beds are hard, but for us it was perfect, I had a good night's sleep everynight we were there. I was a little scared of the timeshare horror stories, but the people at the Melia were great, they told us no pressure and that is exactly what we got. We listened to the speech for 90 minutes and then we were done and noone from the Melia even brought up timeshares again. I think the neighboring hotel, the Maya or Mayan, was the biggest culprit for timeshares, they were everywhere we went! Thanks to one cab driver who told us you can deflect these salespeople by telling them you are a pilot for any airline...it automatically disqualifies you for a timeshare. The food was good, but the lunch and breakfast buffets need to change their menu around, as well as the night snack bar.....the same thing time and time again gets boring. The only thing I didn't like was wearing the bracelet until we checked out. I don't know about these reviews saying you had to get up early to claim your chair by the pool but that never happened to us, anytime we went down to the pool there were ample seats available. We are hoping to go again next year!

reviews.title: Little upset
reviews.text: Just returned from Puerto Vallarta after spending 7 nights at Melia. We were a little upset upon our arrival. We stayed at Melia in Ixtapa Mexico last year, a great place. This is why we choose melia in Puerto Vallarta. Thinking the two resorts would be about the same. No way!

reviews.title: Family of Three had an Awesome Time!!!
reviews.text: We did really have a great time. We conplained about our room, being dark overlooking a roof top, lock broken and tv not shuting off. The next day the staff moved us to a nice ocean veiw room.

We decided to return to Puerto Vallarta, for a 2nd year, February 11th-21st for 10 full days of sun & relaxation with our (almost) 13-year old Son(Tristan). We selected the Melia Puerto Vallarta based on location (We love the Marina area because of it's close proximity to the airport and the boardwalk of shops and restaurants) and price (It was nearly $2,000 less than the resort we stayed at last year, the Velas Vallarta). I booked a Deluxe Garden-View room (least expensive option) on Expedia.com with direct flights from Chicago for only $1200/pp and was overjoyed when we arrived at check-in, received VIP bracelets and were automatically upgraded to the M Experience room at no extra charge! What a great surprise!
reviews.title: Fantastic! Turned a Lemon into Lemonade..Read On For The Full Story!

reviews.text: Our room was not ready when we got there so we decided to walk around and get a lay of the land as well as grab lunch at the outdoor Palapa restaurant. The grounds were beautiful, the pool was large and appealing and our first trip to the buffet was impressive! So much food, a polite staff, and delicious, freshly prepared meals. After lunch, our room was ready and we were directed to room 1501 which is on the 5th floor with a nice balcony & view. Tastefully decorated and with a large LCD TV & 2 full-sized beds, it was perfect for the 3 of us.
reviews.title: Relaxing Week at the Melia

reviews.text: What I found a bit aggravating was the fact that you are greeted by a hotel representative under the guise that they are there to inform you about the layout of the resort and tell you about all of the 'wonderful' excursions available to go on. The reality is that these 'friendly' people (we had Clara) are Time-share or 'Vacation-club' reps that promise you discounts on activities only if you attend their 'high-pressure' presentation the next morning. I committed to the meeting knowing full well what they were doing and canceled minutes before telling her we were not interested. She never bothered us again about it, but never seemed to be as quite friendly after that either ;-)(Turns out they receive $30 for each appointment kept so I understand..) My advice, get the info about the hotel & activities and skip the meeting unless you truly want to buy.
reviews.title: Loved every Moment

reviews.text: Another disappointment was the Fitness Room. I am a fitness fanatic both at home and on vacation and it always seems that, no matter where I travel, the Fitness Room is filled with people who have never worked out before..Tip #1: a vacation is NOT the time to decide you are going to START working out. I watched more people risk their limbs by not knowing how to correctly use a machine or weights. That or they would stay on a cardio machine for 45-60 minutes while others were waiting.. Tip#2: You do not need more that 20-30 minutes of cardio a day..EVER! Despite all that, the room was very small, muggy, and dirty.. Tip #3: Gym etiquette means wiping down all machines after use.
reviews.title: Good quality family time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: So, you've made it this far into my review, it's time to tell you about the Lemon/Lemonade reference:
reviews.title: Awesome resort that's a great value!
Loved the Melia BUT too many kids!
reviews.text: My wife and i belong to the SMVC and decided to give the "west coast" mexico a try after having been to Cancun and Cozumel already.

reviews.title: aa week in paradise
reviews.text: We loved the Puerto Vallarta area and if you go you have to take a whale watching trip thru "ocean friendly" and enjoy seeing these beautiful creatures up close!

reviews.title: Here we are 15 years later
reviews.text: The ONLY problem we had with this vacation was ALL the kids all over the place. When you go to places like this you learn fast who have good parents and who does not. There are MANY responsible parents that keep there children under control BUT their are also MANY who let there children run rampant and don't care.

reviews.title: Memorable 40th anivrsity family gathering
reviews.text: loved the resort; didn't have to reserve chairs by the pool. Lots of activities going on all day. Service was a little slow in some of the restaurants, but the waitstaff was excellent. Wish there had been a separate hot tub area instead of right in the pool. Brought our whole family there for our anniversary & the granddaughters absolutely loved it.

reviews.title: Wonderful Time at the Melia
reviews.text: Stayed a week with another couple, we had been there 15 years ago and thought it was great then, but now it's even better!

We stayed 3 nights at the Melia through United Vacations ($400/person including rt air and transfers to/from hotel). We had a great time! We were given a room on the 8th floor with a view of the ocean that was just beautiful. The room was clean and spacious, as was the bathroom (no rust in our tub). The bed and pillows weren't the most comfortable, but the view made up for that. Service from the staff was very friendly and although they were constantly asking us if we had received the "orientation" - aka timeshare presentation - they didn't hassle us when we turned them down. Bar service was very good, but the food was only ok. The buffets had a large assortment of foods, but by the third day, I was getting ready to try something different. If we had stayed longer, I'm sure we would have gone into town for a few meals. Overall, we had a terrific time and would happily return!
reviews.title: Great Place for a Getaway!
Melia.. just fine
reviews.text: My fiancee and I (mid 30's) stayed at the Melia from April 27th to May 3rd. We were very impressed with the Melia overall. The staff were very friendly and helpful.

GROUNDS....The grounds were beautiful. Lots of wildlife, u can feed the big fish in the pond, feed the Iguanas, and birds, parrots to look at, turtles, at night there are huge frogs in the grass that most people overlook.
reviews.title: Go somewhere else!!!

reviews.text: ROOM....Our room was very nice on the third floor, it overlooked the huge pond and we could see the bay from there with beautiful sunsets. The room did lack plugins but we made due. The bathroom was fine and roomy. We read the beds were hard but we actually liked ours and slept fine. Nice breeze blows right into the room.
reviews.title: For What It's Worth.
Great value
reviews.text: POOL....The pool was big and beautiful. It was very crowded with kids and we really didnt spend much time there. There was one swim up bar and they made good drinks(try the dirty monkey).

aka: Melia Puerto Vallarta All Inclusive Beach Hotel Puerto Vallarta
description: Meliá Puerto Vallarta is a paradise for families and couples, where there is something for everyone and where everything is included. A wide variety of snacks and meals, domestic and imported drinks and recreational activities for all ages, spectacular evening shows performed by professional dancers, with a different program every night, and swimming pool with children's section and 2 whirlpool. The Flintstones have found the perfect place for their holidays: they are staying with your family in one of our first theme hotels: Yabba-Dabba-Doo bazaar, Roca Flash, RocAdventure, Baby Rock Club, Bamm Bamm Club and Cool Club. Let yourself be surprised!
